name: HTML, CSS, and Git: Code Refactor
desc: Given starter code, set-up git repo and improve codebase so that it follows accessibility standards and the site is optimized for search engines

name: Introductory Portfolio
desc: Create a web application from scratch that showcases skills and talents by applying core skills learned such as flexbox, media queries, and CSS variables

name: JavaScript: Password Generator
desc: Modify starter code to create an application that enables employees to generate random passwords based on criteria that they’ve selected

name: Web APIs: Code Quiz
desc: Build a timed coding quiz with multiple-choice questions. This app runs in the browser features dynamically updated HTML and CSS powered by JavaScript code with a clean, polished, and responsive user interface.

name: Third-Party APIs: Work Day Scheduler
desc: Created a simple calendar application that allows a user to save events for each hour of the day by modifying starter code. This app runs in the browser features dynamically updated HTML and CSS powered by jQuery

name: Server-Side APIs: Weather Dashboard
desc: Build a weather dashboard that uses the [OpenWeather One Call API] to retrieve weather data for cities

name: Mid-level Portfolio 2
desc: Used JavaScript to update portfolio with updated GitHub profile with pinned repositories, updated resume, and added social media icons

name: Node.js Homework: Professional README Generator
desc: Create a command-line application that dynamically generates a professional README.md file from a user's input using the [Inquirer package]. This is not a deployed application.

name: Object-Oriented Programming: Team Profile Generator
desc: Build a Node.js command-line application that takes in information about employees on a software engineering team, then generates an HTML webpage that displays summaries for each person. Tests were written every part of the code. This is not a deployed application.

name: Express.js: Note Taker
desc: Modify starter code to create an application that can be used to write and save notes. This application will use an Express.js back end and will save and retrieve note data from a JSON file. Application is deployed to Heroku

name: MySQL Homework: Employee Tracker
desc: To architect and build a solution for managing a company's employees using node, inquirer, and MySQL

name: Object-Relational Mapping (ORM): E-Commerce Back End
desc: Build the back end for an e-commerce site by modifying starter code. You’ll configure a working Express.js API to use Sequelize to interact with a MySQL database.
